sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"群，帮，伙"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: group, crowd, gang, band, mob, throng, masses, swarm
means: group ： 普通用词，通常指有组织、有秩序的一群人，也可指无意汇集在一起的一群人。
crowd ： 常指无组织地乱哄哄地挤在一起的人群。
gang ： 常指从事非法、暴力或敌对活动的帮派或团伙。有时呈中性，词义同group。
band ： 多指一群有明确宗旨，为共同目的而结合在一起的人，常含贬义。
mob ： 指无组织、乱七八糟凑合在一起的乌合之众，或指聚集在一起寻衅滋事的人群，多为暴徒。
throug ： 书面用词，意义接近crowd，侧重密集地挤在一起的一群，含挤在一起向前推进之意。
masses ： 指群众或人民大众。
swarm ： 指人数众多，杂乱无章，不停移动的一群人。

sentence.Network_cn: 过来吧，好多老朋友都在这儿。

sentence.Network_en: There are problems of urban decay and gang violence.
sentence.Network_cn: 存在城市衰败和帮派暴力的问题。

jx.jx_en_mean: To join together in opposition or attack

lj.lj_ly: The older children were always ganging up on the little ones.

jx.jx_en_mean: To act together as a group

lj.lj_ly: various agencies ganging up to combat the use of illicit drugs.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, from Old Norse gangr, ganga 'gait, course, going', of Germanic origin; related to gang. The original meaning was 'going, a journey', later in Middle English 'a way passage', also 'set of things or people which go together'
Old English gangan, of Germanic origin; related to go

encyclopedia.content: 基本释义 n. 1.一帮，一伙（罪犯） 2.一帮，一群，一伙（闹事、斗殴的年轻人） 3.【非正式】一伙 4.一对，一组 v. 结成一伙 同义词 [n.] crew, mob, pack, work party [v.] gang up 常用短语 gang up 聚集，会合，合伙袭击，联合施加压力 press gang 拉夫队，拉壮丁队；一群记者，一伙新闻工作者 road gang 道班，筑路队，修路的犯人；一群拦路抢劫的土匪，车匪路霸 chain gang n. <主美>以铁链锁住一群做苦工的囚犯 sectio

entry.tran: 一帮，一伙（尤指滋事的年轻人）
entry.def: A gang is a group of people, especially young people, who go around together and often deliberately cause trouble.

example.ex: During the fight with a rival gang he lashed out with his flick knife...
example.tran: 在与敌对帮派的打斗中，他挥舞着弹簧折刀一通猛刺。

example.ex: Gang members were behind a lot of the violence...
example.tran: 很多暴力事件是流氓团伙成员暗中策划的。

entry.def: A gang is a group of criminals who work together to commit crimes.

example.ex: Police were hunting for a gang who had allegedly stolen fifty-five cars.
example.tran: 警方正在追捕一个被控盗窃了55辆汽车的犯罪团伙。

entry.def: The gang is a group of friends who frequently meet.

example.ex: Come on over, we've got lots of the old gang here.
example.tran: 过来吧，好多老朋友都在这儿。

entry.tran: 一群，一队，一组（一起干体力活的人）
entry.def: A gang is a group of workers who do physical work together.

sentences.sentence: "police tried to break up the gang"
"he still hangs out with the same crowd"

means.word_mean: 4. tool consisting of a combination of implements arranged to work together

list.explanation: 抓…当兵，强征…入伍，强迫或诱劝…参加或做(某事)

example.en: The voters were press-ganged to the polls.
example.zh: 选民们被动员去参加投票了。

means.word_mean: (罪犯有组织的)一帮, 一伙

sentences.en: The phone box was vandalized by a gang of youths.
sentences.cn: 那电话亭被一群少年歹徒故意破坏了。

sentences.en: The gang are planning a robbery.
sentences.cn: 那帮罪犯正在计划抢劫。

means.word_mean: (工人有组织的)一队, 一组

sentences.en: A whole gang of builders is there tonight.
sentences.cn: 今晚整队建筑工人都在那儿了。

sentences.en: The foreman ganged the men together.
Children like to gang each other.
sentences.cn: 孩子们喜欢成群结伙相互攻击。

sentences.en: He often ganged his pupils to play hide-and-seek.
sentences.cn: 他经常将学生分成伙玩捉迷藏游戏。

means.word_mean: 结伙行动; 合伙攻击

sentences.en: The boy was frail and never ganged with his fellows at school.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩身体虚弱, 从不和同学们一起玩。
